job.name: Visdom_Service_Example
job.description: This workflow shows how to use PCA to ease deployment of service dependencies. Here, VisdomTask needs Visdom service. First, a bind_or_start_service task (Examples/5. Cloud Automation Task Templates), specifies the service we want to start, and an instance name, which is inherited by a job variable. Thus, VisdomTask can use a "endpoint" variable where service is running. Everything is handled by the previous bind_or_start_service task. Also, opening result of bind_or_start_service in a browser, you are automatically redirected your Visdom dashboard. You can also retrieve this URL from PCA portal. Once VisdomTask is finished, job goes through a Validation step so the Visdom keeps running and the user can still visualize his results. Go to the notification portal and validate to terminate the service with the task terminate_service and then the, job properly. You can share Visdom service reusing the same instance name.

task.name: Wait_Until_Validation
task.description: Task to pause the job and send a validation message to the notification service

script.code:
# Please fill variables notification_message = 'Please validate to terminate the service'
# Don't change code below unless you know what you are doing from org.ow2.proactive.addons.webhook import Webhook
jobid = variables.get("PA_JOB_ID") schedulerURL = variables.get("PA_SCHEDULER_REST_URL")
print schedulerURL # get sessionid schedulerapi.connect()
# pause job schedulerapi.pauseJob(jobid)
# send web validation print "Sending web validation..." url = schedulerURL.replace("/rest", "") +'/notification-service/notifications' headers = '{\"Content-Type\" : \"application/json\" }' notification_content = '{\"description\": \"'+notification_message+'\", \"jobId\": \"'+jobid+'\" , \"validation\": \"true\"}' Webhook.execute ( 'POST', url, headers, notification_content); print "Web Validation sent"
